description: Stash720 is a quick-playing, fast-investing, stock market card game, played in a way similar to the classic board game, Monopoly. To win, be the first player to collect 3 complete Stock Card sets in different colours. This card game is a great way to help learn basic economics, risk and reward, while dealing with stock trading in as little as 15 minutes. It comes with 110 cards, including Stock Cards, Stock Growth Cards, Wild Stock Cards and Power Cards. Power Cards let players do things such as charge Stock Growth and force favourable investments. Wild Stock Cards help players build Stock sets. Players pay their debts with Bitcoin Cards, or their stock cards if they are out of Bitcoin.

A hilarious Dutch party game based on statements that have actually appeared on the internet. From bizarre conspiracy theories to silly sales ads. From right-wing 'wappies' statements to left-wing bicycle boomer quotes. Everything passes by.

The goal of the game is similar to the goal of life: raking in as many likes as possible. You do this by making status updates. Is your status the most hilarious one on the table or is it so tasteless that your fellow players like it? Then you will receive likes.

—description from the publisher (translated)

An economical deck-builder for managing an amusement park, designed for 1-4 players, with a game time from 45 to 60 minutes. By running our own amusement park, we will be able to purchase attractions that generate happiness, which in turn will attract more visitors to our kingdom of fun. And these are an irreplaceable source of income. We will be able to spend the earned money, for example, on the purchase of decorations for our park, which will give us victory points. But not to be so rosy, people visiting the funfair like to litter and be fussy; attractions break down all the time and the employees are demanding payment! In addition, we must deliberately manage the park space, which is not unlimited. The goal of the game is to collect as many park recognition points as possible

At the height of the Minoan civilization, it is said that there was a game that the nobles used to play, in which they tried to dominate a board by placing borders and pawns, using strategy as well as cunning. The game you are about to play is an approach to this ancient game, one of the first board games ever made!

Overview: 
ΔιαÎ¯ρεσις (Division) is a tactical game for two players. During the game, players place borders on the game board, dividing it into areas in which they try to gain the majority by placing pawns.
At the end of the game, each player counts the number of squares in the areas on which they have the majority, and the player with the most squares is the winner.
In case of a tie the game ends in a draw.

Contents:
1 Game Board
18 borders (6 small, 6 medium, 6 large) in two colors
12 pawns (8 small and 4 large) in two colors

There's work to be done in the fairy-tale kingdom, from transporting golden eggs to unblocking elven sewers.

Can you assemble the best team of wizards for each job?

You play as magical agents who are recruiting wizards as they walk into the local fairytale gathering-house looking for work. Chris invented and drew twenty-one original wizards - from Hercule the Impressive, master of mechanical magic to Small Norman, who is fairly good at not causing trouble. There's also a host of clients offering all sorts of gigs - your wizards might end up doing maze-building work for a Minotaur, putting in a shift at the magical bakery, or joining a dance troupe.

In each round, players compete to recruit wizards for the four different roles that the client needs, possibly bringing a familiar along to help out. Only the best team gets the job. So will you trust Sporegard Drizzle to put on a firework display for the king, or should you really wait to hire someone less damp?

—description from the publisher

Using the cards you can assemble "A crazy party in Paris" (XIXth century) or an "the last days of the Aztecs", with 16 cards each in a 4x4 matrix.

The first player who finds Wally gets 10 points. But there are other 10 questions (1 point each) that you have to answer finding the information in the cards

Ð’Ð¾Ð»Ðº Ð¸Ð´Ñ‘Ñ‚! ("The Wolf is Coming!") is a family board game in which all players will need to team up and throw a great birthday party for their friend Wolf. The recipe for such a party is known to everyone - cakes, candles, balls, gifts... But the Wolf is already going home, and the surprise is not ready! Squirrel, Badger, Fawn and Magpie need to hurry up, because if the Wolf comes to an empty house, he will be upset that his friends have forgotten about him. So they run through the forest, looking for goods and gifts - the main thing is to get ahead of the birthday boy and be the first to be at his house with everything you need.

The players take turns. On their turn, the player performs several actions in sequence:

     Moves the hero's standee.
     Performs an action with a forest token.
     Moved the Wolf standee one step closer to the house (this action is mandatory).


All the animals move on different numbers of steps and can carry different numbers of objects in their paws. They can also encounter various obstacles in the forest. In order to complete them, they need to perform various tasks.

The game will end when the Wolf reaches the house. If all is ready for the party, the team wins. If the party does not happen, the wolf will be disappointed. Unfortunately, in that case, the team loses.

—description from the publisher (translated)

A Lovecraftian Card Game by Hugo Bustilho from QG BUSTILHO where players summon monsters and investigators to have the greatest cult in Elder Rites.

Object
Build your Cult and perform Summon Rituals! To win you must have more Invocation Points at the end of the game. The first player to reach 21 Invocation triggers the end of the game.

Gameplay
The game is played in turns. The first player begins his turn, with one move passing to the next player on the left. 
In one turn, follow this order (some card effects you previously played may modify these steps).
1. Buy two cards from the principal line.
2. Make a Invocation or Play a card into your Cult or Pass.
3. Stay with 7 cards in your hand.

Um Jogo de Cartas Lovecraftiano de Hugo Bustilho do QG BUSTILHO onde jogadores incocam monstros e investigadores para ter o maior Culto em Ritos Ancestrais.

Objetivo
Construa seu Culto e realize Rituais de Invocação! Para vencer você deve ter mais Pontos de Invocação no final do jogo. O primeiro jogador a chegar a 21 de Invocação dispara o fim do jogo.

Gameplay
O jogo é jogado em turnos. O primeiro jogador começa seu turno, com uma jogada passando para o próximo jogador à esquerda. 
Em um turno, siga esta ordem (alguns efeitos de cartas que você  jogou anteriormente podem modificar essas etapas).

1. Compre duas cartas da linha principal de compras.
2. Faça uma Invocação ou jogue uma carta da sua mão no seu Culto ou Passe a vez.
3. Fique com no máximo 7 cartas na sua mão.

Reclaim is a flip-and-write game where players will be drawing polyominos on their board and drawing triangles within certain terrains of already placed shapes to pay the cost of the new shapes.

Once a shape has been entirely filled with such triangles, the triangles within that polyomino are shaded in.

After 10 rounds, an initial scoring happens, where players earn points based on the number of castles connected by paths of hollow triangles.  After a few more rounds, where the costs of placing a piece have doubled, players again score for connecting castles with hollow triangles but also the largest rectangle of shaded triangles (and castles). The player with the most points wins.

Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza: FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is a official licenced game for the Football World Cup.

Although the gameplay is the same as Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza, this version has unique actions cards (yellow card, goal and Wisthle) with unique gestures.

Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza is filled to the brim with hand-slapping mayhem! As in Snap and Dobble, each player places a card from their hand face up into a community pile while saying taco/cat/goat/cheese/pizza in player sequence. When the card matches the mantra — boom! — everyone slaps their hand on the deck, with the last one to slap picking up the cards. Whoever rids themselves of cards first wins!

In this game 2-4 players team up with unicorn Milly Muffin to find the three butterflies hidden in magical trees and bring them back to the meadow.

Players take turns rolling a special die and according to the result move either the unicorn or the butterfly-hunting raccoon.

Whenever the unicorn lands on a space accompanied by a tree the turn player shakes that tree, then all players guess whether there's a butterfly or a dung beetle hidden inside.

Muffins found along the way can be used to distract the raccoon or take Milly to a tree of the player's choice.

The players win if they find all the butterflies and the unicorn reaches the meadow before the raccoon does.

A game based in the Mexican politics where you will play as a political candidate at election time.
You will use money, a resource of money, but above all, you will cheat.

First you roll a die in order to get 1 of 3 cards available. You can use those cards in order to get another cards or to eliminate your candidate opponents. 
All the time you can cheat, that's a rule from the game

Komorebi Parade is played over 2 phases, each consisting of a variable number of rounds, depending upon the player count. On a turn, a player drafts a tile from a public selection and places it on their player board.  The player then can move some tiles on their board depending upon the tile's movement rules.

At the end of the first phase, each player scores for the three public goals which were chosen during setup.  At the end of the second phase, the players again score for the three public goals, but also their private goal.

The player with the most points wins.

Zum is a trick-taking card game for 2-4 players, but up to 6 can play with one deck of cards. “The best of all for skill and fun”.

The game consists of Forty-eight playing cards, numbered 1 to 48, and 12 score cards. Eleven of the score cards bear a picture of the “Zum” Girl with the words “Score” or “Lose”. The twelfth score card is called the “Chance-It” card.

The object of the game is to capture the “Score” cards while forcing your opponents to take the “Lose” cards.

In Zum each player is dealt 12 playing cards. The 12 score cards are shuffled into a separate face up pile with only the top card visible. The winner of each trick (highest card) takes the top card from the score card pile. Scoring cards taken by players are kept face down until all of the playing cards have been played at which point each player counts their score.

Troia! Una Guerra di Eroi is a Strategic  level board-wargame for two players or sides, which simulates the Trojan War.
 The two players respectively control the Achaeans with their allies and the Trojans with their allies. The game reproduces the last period of the war, with approximately monthly turns. The game map includes the entire area where the war was fought, namely the western coasts of Asia Minor and Thrace. The two armies were composed of a multitude of contiguous allies, coming from different regions of Greece and Asia Minor, represented in the game by combat units and Heroes. The Heroes have the names of the Homeric tradition, but can be thought of as chiefs of armed contingents of the Bronze Age. Players must ponder the use of their forces and the stratagems at their disposal to win the last battle: the conquest of the fortress of Troy.

Free for Para Bellum subscribers

RIZE is a fun and challenging memory game for 1-4 players in which players try to remember their cards and race to get rid of them first.

To play, quickly memoRIZE your cards, turn them face-down, and play one that matches the color, number, or shape on the face-up card in the center. The first person to play all their cards wins. But be careful, because you’ll be penalized if you choose the wrong one. And as you draw more cards, it gets even harder to remember what’s in front of you.

Throughout the game, use special cards to gain advantages or thwart your opponents as you work to be the first player with no cards left.

-description from the publisher

Players are about to start a trail running race, taking place in a mountain valley.

First player to reach the finish line wins.

In the valley, there are different terrains : forest, grass, rocks and snow. Throughout the race, players will have to choose their own path according to their own abilities on each terrain.

They must manage their effort : tiredness will slow them down.

Players can improve their abilities, restore their stamina and slow down their opponents through playing cards, picked at aid stations.

There are 3 game modes : 

     competitive (2-4 players)
     2vs2
     solo

I’m not a human is a fast-paced game where the AI-generated artwork meets the human ingenuity. One of you takes on the role of a human pretending to be a robot in the world of AI supremacy. Relying on other players’ associations they try to find the image password for the secret AI site… And even if the human is at a loss they still can outsmart the robots and win!
Before the game players lay down pictures in a 3X3 grid and give each card a number plate from 1 to 9. Then they choose one random bag with cards and deal them to everyone according to the rules.
One player may become human and all other robots will know what picture is the correct one.
One by one robot players name their associations to show other players that they are robot and to confuse the human. Human tries to pass of as a robot.
When all players named their associations human may try to guess the correct picture. If he is not doing that all players explain their associations and vote on who's the human.

In 1812: The Retreat the players are captains of a company leading their soldiers out of Russia during Napoleon's catastrophic campaign of 1812. The players must survive the retreat by making it safely to Vilnius or the Polish border. A soldier that loses all his strength dies on the side of the road or freezes at the bivouac and is disqualified. They can also be captured by the Cossacks. At the end of the game, each soldier is worth a number of victory points. The player with the most points wins the game...but remember: there WILL be casualties!
1812 is a resource management/survival game very high in theme. It is fresh, daring and cutthroat...

The game is played in 3 phases consisting of a number of rounds: From Moscow to Smolensk, from Smolensk to the Berezina and from the Berezina to Vilnius. At the end of each phase, benefits lie in wait for the soldiers in the vanguard arriving at the location first. At the end of each round, a main event card will be drawn which will have consequences for all the soldiers on the board: this can be cold, snow, an attack of the cossacks or maybe a village in the distance that can be explored...

All players have a number of soldiers under their control: an officer, a musician, light infantry, heavy cavalry... Each of them have their own advantages. The loss of any of your soldiers during the game will always have consequences for your company for the remainder of the retreat.             


—description from the designer

You play detective chickens who are looking for turnip thief. All seven suspects are depicted on the game board this is: grandfather, grandmother, granddaughter, dog, cat, mouse and the turnip itself. Next to each suspect lies a round token, on the underside of which it is indicated, who is this character: innocent, kidnapper or accomplice.
Chickens walk around the game board, collecting cards of the investigation: clues, signs and witnesses. If you got a card, you can go to the suspect, present it, tell why it points to this character, and look at his token in secret. When you find the kidnapper, you will have to come to him and bring charges: a motive card and three matching consequence cards. Tell why the attacker stole the turnip, how do you managed to figure him out and whether he had an accomplice. If you do everything right you will win.

Mist is a trick-taking game for exactly 4 players using a standard deck of 52 cards, but for which you can see the suits on the rear of the cards.

Each player's hand begins face down in front of them with a chip on it.  During the game, players can remove chips from their cards, 2 at a time, to look at their values; however, they must remember not to forget the value, as they cannot look at it again.  The chips which are removed in this way will be used as a player's bid.

Chips remaining on cards which are played to tricks form a pool which is given to the player who wins a trick.  Chips acquired in this way are used to convert a player's unplayed card to a trump card.

The player with the most points after 4 rounds wins.

Capital Campaign is a heavy worker placement/tableau-building game featuring variable abilities, unique worker roles, a rapidly-escalating scale of play, and many paths to victory.

The signature mechanism that drives the game is gathering and planning out your resource management within a limited number of turns before they are gone and you start the next year fresh.

Capital Campaign allows players to immerse themselves in a deep, rich world of philanthropy and doing the most good to come out on top.

—description from the publisher

This is a quirky card game, where you get a maximum of 20 questions to guess what or who your opponent is.

They could be an animal, vegetable, mineral or something completely random like a stapler or maybe a person like Harry Potter. It all depends on what they choose to be from the card they've picked.

It sounds easy doesn't it, but don't be fooled, as the person can only answer your questions with a Yes or No. Choose your questions wisely as twenty questions will soon fly by or you might be lucky and guess the answer in less!

—description from the publisher

Manipulate and cooperate your way to dominance of the world’s first bourgeoning democracy in Ancient Athens.

The players aim to score the most points by successfully fulfilling the requirements of their secret Agendas and by building Public Works.

These secret Agendas dictate which Policies the player will want to pass or dismiss.

In order to pass or dismiss a Policy, players vote by spending Influence, which they draw in their turn, and Drachma, which can be used as bribes when voting on Policies or to fund Projects.

Once 7 Policies have been passed the game ends. The themes of these 7 Passed Policies dictate whether a player has been successful or unsuccessful in fulfilling their Agendas. Players then score Victory Points for any Agendas they have successfully fulfilled. Players lose points for any Agendas they have not fulfilled.

-description from publisher

Ballads & Tales is an atmospheric dungeon-crawling board game for 1-5 players. Up to 4 players can enjoy the game in solo/coop mode. Creatures are divided into three groups, each with their own behavioral patterns, so they can act cleverly and threateningly. Adventure cards offer thrilling discoveries and surprises, with no game master needed.

An additional player can take control of the evil creatures in game master mode to try and defeat the heroes!

Dangerous times have fallen over the Empire of Bromyr. The noticeboards are full of urgent quests: Defeat hordes of creatures, find magical artifacts, face challenging bosses, break mysterious time loops, or remain undiscovered in exciting stealth missions. Help villagers in their time of need and survive the deadly Corruption in infected areas. The base game contains 15 individual adventures and a wide selection of creatures.

The extensive travel mode is part of the Core Box. In this mode, Heroes travel all over the Duchy of Wennheim, across the included map in the style of a sandbox world. Their goal is to enter 6 antique dungeons and to activate the artifacts hidden within. 12 additional adventures are randomly generated. The included Travel cards influence the heroes’ journey with many random events, such as these: A bounty has been posted on the heads of dangerous boss monsters. A quarantine prevents you from accessing a specific village. Homunculi occupy all bridges and keep you from traveling onwards.

At the same time, heroes will need to keep an eye on the weight of their luggage and eat regularly, so they don’t start their next adventure in a weakened state. To increase their maximum load, heroes can buy a donkey.

The artwork of Ballads & Tales is a special highlight. Traditional artist Valbona Atanaskovska (Bona), who earned a degree from the Art Academy of Skopje (North Macedonia) in 1997, has painted all characters in oil on canvas. In addition, she has produced oil paintings of the different cover designs, as well as all objects on the cards. She has also created all drawings for event and spell cards, so the characters are all in the same style.

ãƒˆãƒªãƒ†å¯Œè±ª is a game that combines "Trick Taking" and "Millionaire".

The game uses a deck of cards with ranks and suits, but each card also shows an animal which acts as a second suit.  During the trick-taking phase, players who play off-suit to a trick will take their cards back and they are placed into that player's hand for the next phase; the winner takes the remaining cards into their hand for the next phase. Some cards have special effects and the winner of each trick obtains a yellow cube.

If a player collected no cards for their millionaire hand, the game ends prematurely.  Otherwise, the players take their new hands and play a climbing game. The following possibilities are intricate, due to the game's card distribution and two-suit nature.

The game has a number of unique elements.  For instance:


    The start player of each trick (for both halves) can choose the direction of play for each trick.
    In the millionaire phase, players can only play a single card until "energy bundles" are created.  These go into a central pool and can be spent by any lead player to trigger a round of playing pairs, triple, etc.

Having to spend most of their time in the sewers, the lives of Tokyo's disreputable Poo Divers consistently suck. The lowest caste of all underdogs sits in the Shinjuku honky-tonk as they do every night after work, digesting their lost time. Delirious thoughts waft through cesspools, spilling into an endless nirvana of drunken stupor and hubris. The only fixed point of their blank stares is the smudged cup with the stomach ulcering mixed drinks of Don’t Ask and Definitely Don’t Ask. A hot, stuffy, yet wild vibe drools through the humid air. It drools saliva that the divers inhale and excrete again as armpit sweat.

The divers brag about their precious finds from Tokyo's sewers. In drunkenness, yellow slime hardens into gold ingots and rat poison mutates into cocaine. Or was there really a giant diamond that a courier frantically shat out shortly before the raid? What is the truth about the silver coins that Akito once claimed to have found? And did he really exist, that mummified politician Tanaka slurs about every night?

Two to four players get up close and personal with the secret society of Poo Divers. Take part in their stuffy discoveries and, like them, rejoice in every bit of dirt. In this world, all finds have equal value. But take the advice of a wise Poo Diver and keep your glued eyes open, lest some greedy asshole snatch the loot from under your nose.

BOOMA is a roll & write solitaire game where you will have to manage the workforce to catch the giant snake BOOMA that is ravaging the colony on planet Gliese 3323 b.
You can build electrified walls or generators, create bait or just bomb BOOMA and its clones.

Game Round
Rounds are played in three phases:
- Commander turn
- BOOMA turn
- Advancement on the tracks

During commander turn, perform these steps in order:
1. Roll commander dice
2. Assign values (drawing one of the available symbol on an area, writing the number showing the dice inside the drawing)

During BOOMA turn, perform these steps in order:
1. Roll BOOMA bonus dice and trigger the corresponding effect
2. Move BOOMA and its clone (usually to the adjacent 
orthogonally area with the highest value)
3. Clone growth: If the strength of the clone is less than that of BOOMA, then add 1 to the strength of the clone

Note that BOOMA and its clone are represented by two dice showing the value of the current strength.

You win in case BOOMA and its clone no longer have the 
possibility to move.
You lose as soon as the second city area is devastated.

-description from designer

Sláine: Kiss My Axe! is a skirmish tabletop miniatures battle game for two or more players set in the fantasy world created by the legendary comic creators Pat Mills and Angela Kincaid. Axes and swords clash whilst Earth and Sour magic lash out across the Land of the Young, as the Earth Tribes of the goddess Danu battle the decaying Drune Lords and the relentless Fomorian Sea Demons.

In Sláine, players take control of a small band of Earth Tribe, Drune, or Fomorian warriors as they fight for glory and survival in the mist-shrouded lands of Tir Nan Og and beyond. This starter set contains scenery, tokens, cards and all the rules you need to play, including scenarios, advanced rules and profile lists to create your warbands such as the heroes of the Earth Tribes and Drune Lords included in this set and much more...

—description from the publisher

Choose your player, build their skills, and do everything you can to make Karma work in your favor. BIRDIE Pro is the #1 selling disc golf board game. Play disc golf at your kitchen table and roll to victory.

A fun disc golf board game where strategy can set you up to succeed, but karma waits right around the corner. 13 players offer great replayability. Build your skills and use them wisely. Karma cards offer a dash of luck for you to sprinkle upon yourself or your opponents. Add a few dice and roll your way to victory.

—description from the publisher

Guess the code and get rich! The Monopoly Secret Vault board game for kids 8+ features Mr. Monopoly's vault filled with valuable items that give players more wealth. Begin by filling the vault with riches. Each time a player unlocks it and gets what's inside, it gets refilled with more valuables. Which means there are always plenty of riches to unlock! To open the vault, players guess the code, which is a random number from 1 to 6. Be sure to pay attention to numbers already guessed! In this exciting family board game for 2-6 players, each time the vault is opened, the code randomly resets. Along with Monopoly Money, there are hotels that players can only find in the vault, plus keys to locked properties. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins!

MONOPOLY GAME WITH VAULT: In the Monopoly Secret Vault board game, Mr. Monopoly gives players chances to take riches from his vault -- if they can guess the code to unlock it

CRACK THE CODE AND GET RICH: Players buy properties and collect rent, but in this edition players try to guess the codes to open the vault as many times as possible

FIND MONEY, HOTELS, AND KEYS TO LOCKED PROPERTIES: Inside the vault, find money, hotels, and cardboard keys that allow players to unlock properties

THEMED MONOPOLY TOKENS: Features tokens including Scottie, Top Hat, T-Rex, Hazel. Racecar, and Rubber Ducky -- all designed to look like they're ready to break into the vault

ENTERTAINING FAMILY GAME: The Monopoly Secret Vault board game for 2-6 players is fun for adults, teens, and kids ages 8 and up. It’s a great choice for family game nights, parties, and get-togethers

—description from the publisher

The time has come to sail!  In this game, we have 2 separate missions in one box.  In the first, you can join a Viking crew as they set sail into the fog on a journey to the mythical lands to the west.  The seas are rough and storms threaten to send you to Valhalla, but if you manage to find your way, a land of riches awaits.  Be careful, though, as some of the crew are planning a mutiny and you might just be caught in the crosshairs.  The second game, is a bit darker than the first.  A rival chieftain has his eyes set on your village and he has sent warriors to pillage your home.  It will be up to you to defend your village at all costs.  Set traps for the invaders, hide your treasures, and prepare to face them head-on.  The choice is yours.  Both missions are available at the start.  Will you bring glory to your people or will you find yourself lost to history?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Get ready for an unforgettable adventure throughout Chile! Discover and collect postcards of its culture, flora & fauna, cities and history. Manage your ‘chauchas’ and build your itinerary strategically, to achieve the most spectacular postcard collection of Chile’s immense natural and cultural wealth. Compete with your family and friends to be rewarded with the highest amount of ‘Copihues’ at the end of your journey. Embark in this adventure through unimaginable landscapes, delight yourself with Chile’s delicious typical meals, and tour the most majestic parks and pristine reserves. Sign-up for various tours, and expand your collection to become the most intrepid Backpacker!

—description from the publisher (translated)

¡Prepárate para la aventura en un inolvidable viaje a lo largo de Chile! conoce y colecciona su cultura, flora y fauna, ciudades e historia. Gestiona tus chauchas y arma tu itinerario de manera estratégica, para lograr la más linda colección de postales de la inmensa riqueza natural y cultural Chilena. Compite junto a tu familia y amigos en busca de ser premiados con la mayor cantidad de Copihues al momento de finalizar el viaje. Embárcate en esta travesía por paisajes fuera de serie, deléitate con ricos platos típicos y recorre los mas majestuosos parques y prístinas reservas. Apúntate en diversos tours y expande tu colección para competir por ser el mas intrépido Mochilero.

—description from the publisher

Three precious jewels have been stolen from history by our enemy, Mr. X, and have been locked up safely in the Royal Museum.  These need to be returned to their correct time periods, or else a time paradox might occur.  We need you to do the impossible… break into one of the most well-guarded museums on the planet.  We have a team assembled to help, but it will ultimately be up to you to find your way into the grounds, pass the security measures, and nab those jewels.  Along the way, you might come across dinosaur skeletons, Egyptian relics, and priceless works of art…all of which hold clues to help you in your heist.  Be careful, though.  Just getting to the jewels is not enough.  Once you have them in hand, you will need to find a way out of the museum, as alarms inevitably wail.  Can you pull off the heist of the century?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

The Flashback cruise was intended to be a way to revisit the '90s in fun ways that kids from back in the day would describe as "all that and a bag of chips." Some of the most popular child celebrities from the '90s, all managed by Jake Murray, were scheduled to be aboard for a week of sunny nostalgia, discussions about which flip phone was better, and whether or not you prepped for Y2K. When Jake Murray is found dead aboard the ship, all indications point to one of his celebrity clients as the killer. Unfortunately, you are one of those celebrities, and are implicated in the crime by the fact that something belonging to you was used as the murder weapon. Because jurisdiction out on the open water is tricky, you have a few hours before the Ladybird is due back at port to find out who the real killer is and expose them for the criminal they are. Can you Flashback to an era of slap bracelets, Furbies, and floppy disks and find out which of your '90s celebrity friends is really a cold-blooded murderer?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

An old friend, Simon Newall, owner of Retro Corner Arcade, reaches out to you to help solve a mystery that his father left behind, hidden in secret levels of certain arcade machines. You agree without hesitation, eager to reconnect with one of your childhood buddies. However, your hopes of a reunion are dashed when you arrive at the arcade and learn from his wife that Simon was killed during a burglary gone wrong. As one last favor for an old friend, you decide to do as Simon asked and figure out what secret was worth hiding in such a strange way. Are you ready to play? If so, Insert Coin!

Difficulty Rating – 6/10

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

S.T.A.L.K. is the premiere group of ghost hunters in Valley Falls.  You will assume the role of Kristina Noble, a local paranormal investigator who comes from a long line of psychics and clairvoyants.  You are being considered for a spot in the group because of your passion for the supernatural and your investigative skills.  While on a weekend camping trip in Easthaven Forest, you and the members of S.T.A.L.K. stumble across an unmarked grave deep in the woods.  Because opportunities like this don't happen every day, the group decides to try and use paranormal investigation techniques to determine the identity of the body and learn what happened.  Investigate The Unmarked Grave and follow wherever the trail leads.  But, be warned!  Easthaven Forest is known for its multitude of secrets.  Who knows what dark truths you will discover once you drag those into the light?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

The silence of a quiet night at Valley Falls Dispatch is shattered when a frantic call comes in. The man on the line says he is being chased and rambles about something that happened in the past with him and a group of friends. Then, the call is abruptly disconnected. When the police pinpoint the location of the call and arrive on the scene, they discover the caller's dead body. Written in blood on the wall behind the body is a message that reads, "Follow the Leader 2017."  Something terrible happened 5 years ago, and someone is out for revenge. Old scores will be settled. Old secrets will be uncovered. Will you Follow the Leader and live to tell about it?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

In Hunt A Killer: Blair Witch, you play a 6-episode story and solve the mystery of Burkittsville. Completing each episode solves one piece of the puzzle, and builds your case for the larger mystery.

Blair Witch Season 2 Box Set is a self-directed storyline perfect for experienced detectives looking to test their skills against the supernatural forces that lurk in the woods. This full season will test hardened and new detectives, alike. After the events of Blair Witch Season 1, a team of podcasters arrives in Burkittsville, hoping to find information on the Blair Witch. But when the team vanishes on a seemingly routine trip into the woods, you must help Ed Barrett solve the mystery of what happened to them.

Use your detective skills to decode ciphers, solve cryptic puzzles, and uncover the history of Burkittsville.

You do not have to play the first season to enjoy Blair Witch Season 2.

Difficulty: 4/5 - Medium

In Hunt A Killer: Off the Record, you play a 6-episode story and solve the mystery of the murder of Ashley Mendoza. Completing each episode solves one piece of the puzzle, and builds your case for the larger mystery.

Off the Record Box Set is a self-directed storyline perfect for experienced detectives looking to test their skills. After reporting on her town’s mayoral election, journalist Ashley Mendoza is found dead. Help her friend Frannie investigate Ashley’s death and expose her murderer.

Use your detective skills to decode ciphers, solve cryptic puzzles, and uncover the truth.

For each episode:
Check the Objective Card in each box as your goal may change each episode.

Set aside time to dig into the box and read all the materials.

Examine the evidence to uncover critical clues, corroborate alibis, create timelines, and identify each suspect’s means, motive, and opportunity.

Difficulty: 4/5 - Medium

ã²ãã‚‰ã—ã®ãªãé ƒã«ï¼æˆ‘ï¼ ("Higurashi When They Cry: Ware") is a hidden role game where everyone starts in the same situation and it's possible to play successfully without lying. At the beginning of the game everyone has one of each of seven role cards; over five in-game days, players will give each other votes and discard roles until only one is left, which determines who wins.

Each turn ("day"), a player may choose to either vote or destroy a vote. When you vote you give a vote token to any other player and discard your role cards for the day face down. When you destroy a vote, you discard one vote from any player, including yourself, and your discards for the day are face up. At the end of each of the first three days, all discards are shuffled and revealed in total, so you can follow approximately what cards are still in play.

Roles have a variety of victory conditions.

This game is different from æ–¯ãã—ã¦æˆ‘ã¯ç‹¬è£è€…ã«æˆã‚Œã‚Š (Kakushite ware ha dokusaisha ni nareri, "And Thus I Became a Dictator...") as it includes a set of different cards, winning conditions and theme.

Note: The game can be played with up to 12 players, but one box only supports up to 6. For more than 6 players you will need to buy a second set and combine them.

—user summary

Codex Leicester is the reimplementation of Leonardo da Vinci (2006) by Acchittocca  (Flaminia Brasini, Virginio Gigli, Stefano Luperto, Antonio Tinto) in collaboration with the founder of DiceTree Games, Changhyun Baek. It is a new game using the original’s system and theme.

This is a worker placement game for 1 to 5 players, featuring strong player interaction. Playtime lasts approximately 30 minutes per player.

Summary:
Players find themselves as inventors trying to breathe life into their designs, all of which draw their inspiration from the notes of the master himself:  the Codex Leicester of Leonardo da Vinci. Ranging from relatively simple to epic, all these inventions require materials and time to bring them to fruition.
Of course, genius alone won’t get the job done. Get support from the Council and sponsors. You will need to expand your workshops and procure Automata designed by Leonardo himself – all this to increase your work efficiency. Hire apprentices straight out of the academy to nab highly coveted materials from the market before your rivals.

Time is of the essence. Race to be the foremost in completing inventions. You will unlock rewards and special abilities if you are the first player to complete the inventions. Otherwise, you will get less rewards without special abilities.

After 7 rounds, the player who has amassed the largest fortune will be awarded victory!

Who among you will be the most ingenious Renaissance inventor?

-description from publisher

				
				
					=Changes from Leonardo da Vinci (2006):

- The allocation of start game resources has changed. 4 resource selection cards are distributed,  of which 2 are kept, and their corresponding resources are collected. Receive additional resources according to to turn order.

- Competitive elements have been strengthened for a 2 or 3 players game, allowing enjoyment of a similar tension at any player count.

- More invention cards!  An increase from 25 to 40 cards,  with each card having special effects that players can use instantly, once in a round, and permanently.

- More enticing Council options!  An increase from four to eight options, with florins piling up on tiles that no one has chosen each time a new tile is placed.

- Card resources have been replaced with meeples, and player screens have been added.

- Invention card completion has been modified so that everyone knows what inventions are being worked on at any given time.

- Invention cards are now divided into current and future spaces, adding a new dimension for strategic play.

- The 15-week inventions are now only revealed at the start of the game,  allowing players to prepare in advance.

- Restrictions of the workshops have been lifted so that you can upgrade them, as well as add automata,  in the middle of working on an invention.

- Each player now gets six objectives, all of which yield rewards upon fulfillment.  So if you find yourself falling behind in completing inventions, these objectives will help you catch up.

- New effects have been added to the Laboratory and Academy. You can buy 1 work from the Laboratory and 1 resource from the Academy. Now there’s a reason to use the Laboratory and Academy in the later of the game.

- The game consists of 7 rounds. Players pay salaries to hired assistants at the end of rounds 3, 5, and 7. Some effects of the Laboratory and Academy change in rounds 4 and 6.  In round 7, players can sell resources instead of buying them.

- The game comes with a double-sided game board; double-layered player boards; premium wooden, glass, and plastic resource tokens; and 12 transparent containers for storing components.

A 3-player trick-taking game with a must-follow trump card, but there's a 4th player (a robot: 'Robo' in play).

Suits are 1 to 13 in 4 colors. Robo will play cards according to their program, so it depends on their program whether to play small and large number cards when following suit.

You can win up to 3 tricks out of 12 tricks, but if you win 4 tricks or more, you lose points.

The recent discovery of a substance called “Dust” has proven apocalyptic for the residents of the small mining town called Reckoning. Dust allows warping of time, but also has disastrous side effects. Most of the town has now succumbed to the corruption. Only your small posse is left. You need to score a winning poker hand (to buy a ticket on the Wagon out of town). However, spectral forces, tentacles from the deep, and raging fires are not going to make this task easy. Can you escape Reckoning?

This is a solo, thematic hand-management game set in the weird west as things are about to go down.

In the not-so-distant future, every day jobs have been replaced by specialized robots. YOU are one of the premiere manufacturers of these robots. Create intricate circuits to produce the resources necessary for your success. But hurry, the Mainframe at the center of it all is unstable and bound to crash at any moment! Be the player with the most points after the mainframe crashes to win!

Each round you’ll be drafting circuit tiles to increase your resource production, or sabotage other players. Roll dice based on your circuit to earn resources, and spend those resources to buy and build robots. You’ll also get a special helper bot each turn with unique abilities that help you get ahead.

When the mainframe crashes the game is over, you’ll earn points based on how many robots you have in each faction. The more robots you have, the more points you’ll earn. Tally up your points; the player with the most points wins!

—description from publisher

Can you help Hilde to hang up the laundry? Not really a problem, but beware: It's pretty windy outside today and that makes the game an entertaining challenge for children! Throw the Weather Die: If the sun is shining you're lucky and you can hang up a piece of laundry, but if there's a storm you have to press the button and the rotary clothesline will start spinning. Hilde can just hold on tight, but if the clothes fall off the line, you have to start hanging them up again! Whoever hangs up all the clothes of their color first wins.

Humanity has become more daring when sailing the seas. More and more pirate ships venture into the forbidden seas of the gods, endangering their underwater kingdoms and the strange creatures that live there. In Sea Dragons, you must protect the seas by sinking pirate ships, collecting their treasures, and becoming the legendary protectors of the aquatic kingdoms.

In the game, each participant plays as a family of sea dragons who are seeking to become the protectors of the forbidden seas. Each turn, one of the two pattern cards from the hand will be played to position a sea dragon on the board, increasing your presence in all four sea kingdoms. You will be able to sink ships or collect treasures hidden in the ocean. Optionally you can complete missions with the ships that you are sinking. Note that you cannot place your own sea dragons next to each other, and if you place one next to another player's dragon, they receive treasures.

Your long-term goal is to achieve the greatest presence in each of the four kingdoms at the end of the game and get the most victory points by completing missions and collecting treasures.

—description from publisher

La humanidad se ha vuelto más osada al surcar los mares. Cada vez son más los barcos piratas que se aventuran en los mares prohibidos por los dioses, poniendo en peligro sus reinos submarinos y a las extrañas criaturas que allí habitan. Como Dragones del Mar deberán proteger los mares hundiendo a los barcos piratas, recolectando sus tesoros y convirtiéndose en los legendarios protectores de los reinos acuáticos.

Cada participante jugará con una familia de Dragones del Mar. En cada turno, jugaras una de las dos cartas de patrones de tu mano para posicionar un Dragón del Mar en el tablero, aumentando tu presencia en los 4 reinos marinos. Pero cuidado, no podrás colocar tus propios Dragones del Mar uno junto a otro, y si posicionas alguno  junto al de otro participante, le entregaras tesoros. El objetivo será conseguir la mayor presencia en cada uno de los 4 reinos al finalizar la partida y conseguir la mayor cantidad de puntos de victoria cumpliendo misiones y recogiendo tesoros.

Whether you’re newly in love or already married: turn your everyday life into an experience and have a fabulous time full of fun and closeness. Because this game is all about you!

Flitterkiste is a legacy game for two people who love each other. It offers a completely new gaming experience – because the challenges are played for and with each other in everyday life. As a gift, it suits any occasion and can be combined with other presents.

How to play and win:
On your turn each of you draws a secret card with a task from the shared deck. You can solve it within a few days. After this period, you draw the next card. Completed tasks reward you with hearts – the currency of the game. You collect them and can use them to unlock added content and gifts. It is your choice. There are ten locked chapters within the chronicle. When you open and complete the last chapter both of you win the game.
In between you will receive shared cards. They are not secret, and you can solve the challenges together at any time. They will help you to change the rules of the game and give you bonus hearts.

The perpetual calendar always gives you an overview of what is next in the game. He functions as a game board, because this is where you can see your progress and record your goals.

During play you will write, paste over or use up cards and other components. This is how the Flitterkiste develops further and adapts to the interests of the couple.

Components:
133 Unique cards
76 Pages game book
1 Perpetual calendar
31 Sticker
2 Game markers
& lots of love

You are drifting on a deserted island because your ship has been wrecked. The weather on the island is fickle and getting worse, and the island is inhabited by dangerous beasts. You must somehow survive and escape from the terrible island!

Dieson Crusoe is a single player dice game. You will have to use your dice wisely to survive on a deserted island and complete your quest. Store food, gather resources, craft tools, and explore the island. But be careful. You'll also need roofs and fences to avoid harsh weather and ward off raids.

The core mechanic is Dice Rondel system. Each day (round) uses 3 dice. Players have to think about what order to use them. The dice value determines both the type of action and the effect of the action. You'll have to figure out which sequence works best for you.

The sequence, also determines the weather and raids of the next day (next round). Actions that are effective today can pay off tomorrow's damage.

Will you pursue efficiency today or safety tomorrow? Will you create your own solution to the dilemma?

—description from the publisher
